1 ^ Dòmine: 2 ^ Qŭi ingréditur sine mácula et operátur justìtiam
¿~qŭìs habitábit in tabernáculo tuo: qŭi lóquitur veritátem in corde suo
aŭt qŭìs reqŭiéscet in mònte sancto tuo: ^ He who walketh without blemish and worketh justice
who shall dwell in thy tabernacle: who speaketh truth in his heart

1 ^ Dòmine: 3 ^ qŭi non egit dolum in lingŭa sua
aŭt qŭìs reqŭiéscet in mònte sancto tuo: et oppróbrium non accépit advèrsus pròximos suos. ^ who hath not used deceit in his tongue
who shall dwell in thy tabernacle: nor hath done evil to his neighbour
or who shall rest in thy holy hill~?: and hath not taken up a reproach against his neighbours.

1 ^ Dòmine: 4 ^ Ad nìhilum dedúctus èst in conspèctu ejus malìgnus~; timèntes aŭtem Dòminum glorìficat. Qŭi jurat pròximo suo et non décipit
¿~qŭìs habitábit in tabernáculo tuo: ^ In his sight the malignant is brought to nothing
aŭt qŭìs reqŭiéscet in mònte sancto tuo: but he glorifieth them that fear the Lord. He that sweareth to his neighbour and deceiveth not

1 ^ Dòmine: 5 ^ qŭi pecúniam suam non dèdit ad usúram
¿~qŭìs habitábit in tabernáculo tuo: et múnera super innocèntem non accépit~; qŭi facit haĕc
aŭt qŭìs reqŭiéscet in mònte sancto tuo: non movébitur in aĕtèrnum. ^ he that hath not put out his money to usury
who shall dwell in thy tabernacle: nor taken bribes against the innocent~; he that doth these things
or who shall rest in thy holy hill~?: shall not be moved for ever.
